name: Yeast Rolls
description: Fluffy yeast rolls that are soft on the inside and slightly crisp on the outside.
instructions: Scald the milk and add butter, sugar, and salt to the milk when it is lukewarm.
Dissolve the yeast cake in 1/4 cup lukewarm water.
Add the dissolved yeast and 3 cups of flour to the milk mixture and beat thoroughly.
Cover the mixture and let it rise until light.
Cut down the dough and add enough flour to knead, approximately 2 1/2 cups.
Let it rise again after the second rising.
Take the dough and toss slightly on a floured board. Knead well.
Roll out the dough to 1/8 inch thickness and shape with a biscuit cutter.
Take a case knife handle dipped in flour and make a crease through the middle of each piece.
Brush over one-half of each piece with melted butter, fold, and press the edges together.
Place each piece in a well-greased pan, one inch apart, and let rise until light.
Bake in a hot oven for 12 to 15 minutes.

name: Parmesan Cheese Biscuit
description: A savory biscuit made with Parmesan cheese, butter, and a hint of red pepper, topped with a cream and cheese mixture.
instructions: Sift flour and red pepper onto a board.
Rub in Parmesan cheese and butter.
Make a hollow in the center, add egg yolks, salt, and lemon juice.
Work the mixture to a smooth, thick paste.
Roll out very thin and stamp out in small discs.
Place on a floured baking tin, prick with a fork.
Bake in a low oven for a few minutes.
Whip cream, mix with grated Parmesan cheese and red pepper.
Put a small quantity in the center of each biscuit just before serving.

name: Baked Halibut with Nut Sauce
description: Tender baked halibut with a creamy and nutty flavor, served in slices with a rich nut sauce.
instructions: Boil the halibut until tender, then cut it fine and remove the bones.
Add 1 pint of cream and 2 cups of bread crumbs from the inside of bread to the halibut.
Season with salt, pepper, and paprika.
Line a bread pan with waxed paper and fill it with the halibut mixture.
Place the pan in a larger pan filled with hot water.
Bake for 1 to 1Â¼ hours.
Once baked, cut the halibut into slices.
For the sauce, chop and blanch the almonds.
Melt the butter in a frying pan and brown the chopped almonds.
Add 1 pint of sweet cream to the pan and season to taste.
Serve the halibut slices with the nut sauce.
